page.title: 14LOCAL HISTORY, ENFIELD
page.content: Enfield is a northern suburb of London. It was once part of the county of Middlesex, which exists now only as a postal district. The area around Brigadier Hill has a recent housing development in the form of flats. The rest of the housing tends to be the traditional three bedroomed semi-detached or terraced house. The area to the north of St. Lukes parish church is less residential and given over in the main to public parks and private farmland. There are horse riding schools in this farmland area. Further to the north is the M25, the motorway route that will eventually completely encircle London. Most families have the usual electrical consumer goods, go away on holiday at least once a year and have access to a car.
